title: A Survey of Interactive Generative Video
authors: Xintao Wang, Quande Liu, Haoxuan Che, Yiran Qin, Jiwen Yu
summary:
- This paper surveys Interactive Generative Video (IGV), a technology combining generative video models with interactive features for user control and feedback.
- It defines IGV, exploring applications in gaming, embodied AI, and autonomous driving, showcasing how IGV enables interactive virtual worlds, physics-aware environment synthesis, and closed-loop simulation.
- The paper proposes a framework for ideal IGV systems encompassing Generation, Control, Memory, Dynamics, and Intelligence modules, analyzing technical challenges and future directions in each.
- Challenges addressed include real-time generation, open-domain control, long-term coherence, accurate physics simulation, and causal reasoning integration.
- This survey extends previous research by broadening the application scope beyond gaming, including autonomous driving and embodied AI, offering a more comprehensive analysis of IGV and its potential across diverse domains.

title: MediAug: Exploring Visual Augmentation in Medical Imaging
authors: Lei Zhang, Hao Zhang, Canxuan Gang, Zeyu Zhang, Xuyin Qi
summary:
- MediAug introduces a unified framework to evaluate six prominent mix-based data augmentation techniques (MixUp, YOCO, CropMix, CutMix, AugMix, and SnapMix) for medical imaging classification tasks.
- It benchmarks these techniques with ResNet-50 and ViT-B architectures on brain tumor MRI and eye disease fundus image datasets. 
- MixUp with ResNet-50 achieves 79.19% accuracy, while SnapMix with ViT-B achieves 99.44% accuracy for brain tumor classification. 
- For eye disease classification, YOCO with ResNet-50 achieves 91.60% and CutMix with ViT-B obtains 97.94% accuracy. 
- The study demonstrates that specific augmentation strategy and architecture combinations are optimal for distinct medical imaging applications.
